meanings.definition: To make a statement that is too general and not based on specific details or examples.
meanings.sent1: Sometimes, people overgeneralize and assume all cats are afraid of water.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overgeneralize when making assumptions about people.
meanings.sent3: Don't overgeneralize and say all fruits are sweet; some are sour!
meanings.sent4: She tends to overgeneralize, painting all Mondays as terrible days.
meanings.sent5: Overgeneralizing can lead to misunderstandings and false beliefs.

meanings.definition: To draw a broad conclusion based on limited or incomplete information.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overgeneralize and jumps to conclusions without all the facts.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overgeneralize when you don't have all the necessary details.
meanings.sent3: Let's not overgeneralize and assume the whole story based on just one chapter.
meanings.sent4: Overgeneralizing is like trying to solve a puzzle with only a few pieces.
meanings.sent5: Overgeneralizing can lead to misunderstandings and jumping to wrong conclusions.
